column5: http://www.durhamregion.com/articlePrint/169738    I sure would like to meet the two adults on the chair with these boy's...

Yah.. but you don't know the whole story Geoff... What were the kids doing before this happened??  I've rode a chair lift since I was 4 years old.. never seen a reason to fall off one and I've been in some pretty hairy situations as a teacher/ski patrol escorting kids (under 6) etc. The only place you generally get mowed down is right at the loading ramp...
Regardless of what the kids were doing before the slip under the saftey bar, for two adults to sit and watch and NOT help is unfathomable!

I read that story in the Star a couple days ago, if that's the way it actually happened, I don't understand what the 2 adults were thinking, I was pretty disturbed by the story, the kid has pretty serious injuries from th fall
Wayne (and others) it's the 'adults' response to the whole situation is the problem.  I just can't figure it out!?!?!
Well, if they were doing something wrong then those two adults sure taught them a lesson......  Letting a kid fall 30 feet isn't exactly the same as a slap on the behind.
